additionalProperty.name: Customizable Reports
additionalProperty.value: Customizable reports in telematics allow users to tailor data analysis to their specific needs, offering insights beyond standard reports. These reports can be created based on various criteria like vehicle, trip, or driver and can include detailed information on fuel usage, driving behavior and more. This flexibility enables businesses to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), track trends and make data-driven decisions for improved efficiency and safety.

additionalProperty.name: Publicly Accessible API Documentation
additionalProperty.value: Benefits of using a telematics API: improve safety and productivity, while reducing life-cycle costs; optimise business operations and improve efficiency; track and monitor all your assets from one location; modern maintenance (with telematics API data provided) helps to reduce equipment failures; eliminate guesswork - accurate data enables you to make reliable decisions and calculate life-cycle costs.

additionalProperty.name: Document Management
additionalProperty.value: Drivers can use smartphone or tablet to capture delivery photos, record notes, collect electronic signatures and more. Access to these records allows for quick investigation of claims related to overages, shortages, damages, or missed delivery windows. Documents and notes are available anytime, enabling faster processes for tasks like customer invoicing, payroll and operational reviews.

additionalProperty.name: Mapping of POI's
additionalProperty.value: In telematics, mapping of Points of Interest (POIs) involves integrating geographical data about specific locations (like landmarks, businesses, or facilities) into a telematics system for various purposes, including navigation, asset tracking and location-based services. This allows users to easily locate, navigate to, or monitor these points of interest.

additionalProperty.name: OBD
additionalProperty.value: OBD (On-Board Diagnostics) in telematics is a standardized vehicle diagnostic system that allows telematics devices to plug into any vehicle's OBD-II port (standard since 1996) to extract real-time engine and vehicle data like speed, fuel consumption, and diagnostic codes. This data is then combined with GPS tracking and transmitted via cellular networks to provide fleet managers with comprehensive vehicle health monitoring, driver behavior analysis, and predictive maintenance capabilities.

additionalProperty.name: Driver's behavior monitoring
additionalProperty.value: A driver behavior monitoring system is a technology-driven solution that continuously tracks and analyzes how drivers operate their vehicles. By using vehicle telematics, GPS and various in-vehicle sensors, the system collects data on driving actions - speed, acceleration, braking and cornering - to provide real-time insights into driver performance.

additionalProperty.name: Real-time Dashcam capture
additionalProperty.value: Real-time dashcam capture is increasingly becoming a valuable feature within telematics systems, enhancing fleet management and safety. By integrating video with traditional telematics data like GPS location, speed and driving behavior, it provides a comprehensive view of vehicle and driver activity, enabling proactive safety measures and efficient incident response.

additionalProperty.name: Fuel usage reporting
additionalProperty.value: Telematics systems offer advanced fuel usage reporting features that provide detailed insights into fuel consumption, enabling fleet managers to optimize fuel efficiency and reduce costs. These features include comprehensive fuel consumption reports, real-time alerts for potential issues like fuel theft or wastage and tools for monitoring driving behavior that impacts fuel economy.

additionalProperty.name: Trip KPI dashboard
additionalProperty.value: A Trip KPI (Key Performance Indicator) dashboard, integrated with telematics, provides a comprehensive overview of vehicle trip data, enabling fleet managers to track and analyze key performance indicators for efficient fleet management. This dashboard offers insights into various aspects of each trip, such as fuel consumption, distance traveled, driving time, idling time and more, allowing for data-driven decision-making.

additionalProperty.name: GPS Tracking
additionalProperty.value: Telematics incorporates GPS tracking as a core component, enabling the monitoring of vehicle location and movement. Telematics systems use GPS data, along with other information from the vehicle's on-board diagnostics, to provide a comprehensive view of vehicle performance and driver behavior. This data is transmitted to a central system where it can be analyzed and used for fleet management, improving efficiency and enhancing safety.

additionalProperty.name: OBD GPS Tracking
additionalProperty.value: OBD GPS tracking uses a device plugged into a vehicle's On-Board Diagnostics (OBD) port to gather and transmit vehicle data, including location, speed and engine diagnostics, via GPS and cellular networks. This data is then used for telematics applications like fleet management, driver behavior analysis and maintenance scheduling

additionalProperty.name: Traffic
additionalProperty.value: Telematics systems use traffic data to optimize routes, enhance safety and improve operational efficiency in transportation and logistics. By integrating real-time and predictive data, telematics can help reroute vehicles around congestion and hazardous conditions, potentially reducing travel time, fuel costs and accident rates.

additionalProperty.name: POI's
additionalProperty.value: In telematics, Points of Interest (POIs) are specific locations that are relevant to fleet operations, like customer locations, delivery points, or service centers. They are essentially named locations with geographic coordinates that can be used to enhance various telematics features. These features include real-time trip updates, trip management, better ETA analysis and more detailed reporting.

additionalProperty.name: Customer Locations
additionalProperty.value: The Customer Locations feature in telematics allows businesses to track the real-time location of their vehicles in relation to customer addresses. This feature is crucial for fleet management, enabling businesses to optimize routes, improve customer service and enhance overall operational efficiency

additionalProperty.name: Android (Management)
additionalProperty.value: Telematics management on Android involves using mobile applications to monitor, analyze and manage vehicle data collected by telematics devices. These tools allow for real-time tracking, driver behavior analysis, route optimization and more, enhancing fleet management and overall vehicle operations.

additionalProperty.name: iOS (Management)
additionalProperty.value: Managing telematics on iOS means using apps  to track, analyze and manage vehicle data from telematics devices. These tools give you real-time tracking, insights into driver behavior, route optimization and more - making fleet management and vehicle operations a whole lot smoother.

additionalProperty.name: Automated Turn-by-Turn Voice Guidance
additionalProperty.value: Automated turn-by-turn voice guidance is a telematics feature that provides drivers with spoken directions to navigate to a destination. This feature is can be triggered by voice commands or selections on a touchscreen. Telematics systems use GPS, cellular communication or satellite to determine location and provide guidance, often with options for visual aids like maps or route information.

additionalProperty.name: RFID Driver ID
additionalProperty.value: RFID driver identification in telematics allows for tracking which driver is operating a vehicle by using radio-frequency identification (RFID) technology. This feature is especially useful when multiple drivers share the same vehicle, as it enables accurate tracking of vehicle usage and driver behavior.

additionalProperty.name: Maintenance Schedules
additionalProperty.value: Telematics enhances fleet maintenance by providing data-driven insights for scheduling and optimizing maintenance activities. By tracking vehicle data like mileage, engine hours and fuel consumption, telematics allows for more precise and proactive maintenance, leading to reduced downtime, improved efficiency and lower costs.

additionalProperty.name: Vehicle Engine Diagnostics Codes
additionalProperty.value: Telematics systems can integrate with Vehicle Engine Diagnostic Codes, also known as Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTCs). These systems monitor various vehicle components and systems and when a fault is detected, they can relay the corresponding DTCs to a central platform. This allows for remote diagnostics, proactive maintenance and potentially reduced downtime.

additionalProperty.name: Diagnostic Error Code Alerts
additionalProperty.value: Diagnostic trouble codes (DTCs) are alerts generated by a vehicle's onboard diagnostics (OBD) system to indicate malfunctions. Telematics, which combines telecommunications and informatics, can read and interpret these DTCs in real-time, providing immediate alerts to fleet managers and maintenance personnel. This integration allows for proactive maintenance, reduced downtime and optimized fleet management.

additionalProperty.name: C# SDK
additionalProperty.value: A C# Software Development Kit (SDK) that provides pre-built libraries, tools and documentation for developers to easily integrate telematics systems using C# programming language. It simplifies development by offering ready-to-use functions for common tasks like retrieving GPS data, managing fleet operations and generating reports, eliminating the need to write  API code from scratch.

additionalProperty.name: Delphi SDK
additionalProperty.value: A Delphi Software Development Kit (SDK) that provides pre-built libraries, tools and documentation for developers to easily integrate telematics systems using Delphi programming language. It simplifies development by offering ready-to-use functions for common tasks like retrieving GPS data, managing fleet operations and generating reports, eliminating the need to write API code from scratch.

additionalProperty.name: Perl SDK
additionalProperty.value: A Perl Software Development Kit (SDK) that provides pre-built libraries, tools and documentation for developers to easily integrate telematics systems using Perl programming language. It simplifies development by offering ready-to-use functions for common tasks like retrieving GPS data, managing fleet operations and generating reports, eliminating the need to write API code from scratch.

additionalProperty.name: VB.NET SDK
additionalProperty.value: A Visual Basic (VB), originally called Visual Basic .NET (VB.NET) Software Development Kit (SDK) that provides pre-built libraries, tools and documentation for developers to easily integrate telematics systems using Visual Basic programming language. It simplifies development by offering ready-to-use functions for common tasks like retrieving GPS data, managing fleet operations and generating reports, eliminating the need to write API code from scratch.

additionalProperty.name: VBScript SDK
additionalProperty.value: A VBScript Software Development Kit (SDK) that provides pre-built libraries, tools and documentation for developers to easily integrate telematics systems using VBScript programming language. It simplifies development by offering ready-to-use functions for common tasks like retrieving GPS data, managing fleet operations and generating reports, eliminating the need to write API code from scratch.
